text:
In case anyone hasn’t noticed – M$ is forcing the use of Delivery Optimization
for the new Teams updates. 
Delivery optimization (DO) 
DO powers Teams automatic updates, which are required as part of the Servicing
Agreement
. 
Overview: What is Delivery Optimization?
 
Recommended settings: Set up Delivery Optimization
 
Note: Download Mode 100 (Bypass) isn't supported. 
BRIAN ILLNER 
| 
Senior Systems Administrator 
864.250.9227 Office 
864.679.2537 Fax 
Canal Insurance Company 
101 N. Main Street, Suite 400 
Greenville, SC 29601 
[cid:image001.jpg@01DA5297.AABB1E60]
 
WARNING: As the information in this transmittal (including attachments, if any)
may contain confidential, proprietary, or business trade secret information, it
should only be reviewed by those who are the intended recipients. Unless you
are an intended recipient, any review, use, disclosure, distribution or copying
of this transmittal (or any attachments) is strictly prohibited. If you have
received this transmittal in error, please notify me immediately by reply email
and destroy all copies of the transmittal. While Canal believes this
transmittal to be free of virus or other defect, it is the responsibility of the
recipient to ensure that it is virus free and no responsibility is accepted by
Canal (or its subsidiaries and affiliates) for any loss or damage arising
therefrom.

metadata.topic: Forcing Classic Teams users to new Teams

important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
In case anyone hasn’t noticed – M$ is forcing the use of Delivery Optimization
for the new Teams updates. 
Delivery optimization (DO) 
DO powers Teams automatic updates, which are required as part of the Servicing
Agreement
[https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Flearn.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fmicrosoftteams%2Fnew-teams-automatic-upgrade-announced%23servicing-agreement&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C77f31bfca439457a73d208dc20e6c7e8%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638421422838578551%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=DbXv7uj%2BRFOUlzyt1HCAXpF%2BCJa4hjyp6zddSHnCi3Y%3D&reserved=0].

From: 'Amag' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Monday, January 15, 2024 10:07 AM
To: PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Subject: Re: [patchmanagement] Forcing Classic Teams users to new Teams 
CAUTION: This message was sent from outside of Canal Insurance. Please do not
click links or open attachments unless you recognize the source of this email
and know the content is safe. Please report all suspicious emails to
"infosec@canal-ins.com" as an attachment. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
Thanks for your suggestion, Seve. 
Was just thinking whether the issue with the default to block everyone using the
new version, if we have a lot of users using it now I wonder if that might cause
more issues than it fixes? 
I guess some users are just switching back to classic if they experience issues,
but it was the lock out option that MS seems to be forcing early which was my
concern which shouldn't be happening just yet according to their own article,
people should have a choice until the end of March 2024. 
I am beginning to think that perhaps a comms should go out to our users to prep
them for the switch over or do we leave it closer and hope more of the bugs are
ironed out before we are forced over. 
Regards, 
Amag
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/LV8PR13MB66212C44F8C13FC8AAB54B36C57E2%40LV8PR13MB6621.namprd13.prod.outlook.com
